message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.CR 

This paper deals with consistency properties of machine learning methods, which is a core topic in the field of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the optimization difficulty of learning with inconsistent surrogates, which falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper applies the theory to two concrete cases: multi-class classification with the tree-structured loss and ranking with the mean average precision loss, which are both relevant to the sub-categories of cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper presents a new lower bound on the calibration function, which is related to the analysis of the complexity of the learning problem, and thus could also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
